purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the data that identify parts and their versions.
The third edition of this part of ISO 10303 includes the modifications to the second edition listed below.
No ARM EXPRESS declarations and interface specifications have been modified but the ARM has been awarded a new WG number.
No modifications have been made to the MIM schema and the MIM EXPRESS-G diagrams but these have been awarded a new WG number.
purpose.note: Usage of product category removed from mappings.

inscope.li: identification of a version of a part or of a non-countable material;
items within the scope of application module Product identification, ISO/TS 10303-1017;
items within the scope of application module Product version, ISO/TS 10303-1018.

definition.def: material the components of which cannot be counted or do not need to be counted Oil, Helium and sand are examples of non-countable material.
discrete object that can come into existence as a consequence of a manufacturing process A part can contain components, which can be parts or non-countable materials.
crude or partially processed material needed to initiate a manufacturing transformation process Crude oil and iron ore are examples of raw material.

uof.name: Part_And_Version_Identification
uof.description: The Part_And_Version_Identification UoF specifies the data structure for the representation of the identification of a part and a part version.
